channel.title: Comments on: HTML5 And Internet Explorer: Modernizr To The Rescue!

item.title: By: Anonymous
item.dc:creator: Anonymous
item.description: square corners are the new rounded corners?
item.content:encoded: square corners are the new rounded corners?

item.title: By: Paul Irish
item.dc:creator: Paul Irish
item.description: The HTML5shiv project is kind of worked on in collaboration with Modernizr, so its the exact same code. Modernizr does do extra stuff, though so if you like any of its detects, the extra 1k or whatever is probably worth it. :)
item.content:encoded: The HTML5shiv project is kind of worked on in collaboration with Modernizr, so its the exact same code. Modernizr does do extra stuff, though so if you like any of its detects, the extra 1k or whatever is probably worth it. :)

item.title: By: Michel
item.dc:creator: Michel
item.description: I used http://code.google.com/p/html5shiv/ a few days ago Worked very well ONCE I had validated the page!! IE also hates HTML 5 if you have unterminated tags
item.content:encoded:
I used http://code.google.com/p/html5shiv/ a few days ago
Worked very well ONCE I had validated the page!!
IE also hates HTML 5 if you have unterminated tags

item.title: By: Anonymous
item.dc:creator: Anonymous
item.description: Don't quote me on this, but if I remember correctly, I first learned about the need for Modernizr to be up top in the Html5 Boilerplate comments. It's a good project to look through just for ideas and the comments, even if you don't use it. Oh, and WatchMeCode looks really interesting! I'm definitely going to have to check it out. Thanks.
item.content:encoded:
Don’t quote me on this, but if I remember correctly, I first learned about the need for Modernizr to be up top in the Html5 Boilerplate comments. It’s a good project to look through just for ideas and the comments, even if you don’t use it.
Oh, and WatchMeCode looks really interesting! I’m definitely going to have to check it out. Thanks.

item.title: By: Tim G. Thomas
item.dc:creator: Tim G. Thomas
item.description:
If you're just using Modernizr for its shimming capabilities, you might want to check out HTML5Shim ( http://code.google.com/p/html5shim/ ). It, too, brings IE up-to-date with the new HTML5 elements, but is a little lighter-weight than Modernizr.
Oh, and don't forget to put it in your <head>, too. :)
item.content:encoded:
If you’re just using Modernizr for its shimming capabilities, you might want to check out HTML5Shim ( http://code.google.com/p/html5shim/ ). It, too, brings IE up-to-date with the new HTML5 elements, but is a little lighter-weight than Modernizr.

Oh, and don’t forget to put it in your <head>, too. :)

item.title: By: Derick Bailey
item.dc:creator: Derick Bailey
item.description: yeah... maybe i was just getting a little over-excited about "OOOOH! SHINY CSS3!!!!" :D
item.content:encoded: yeah… maybe i was just getting a little over-excited about “OOOOH! SHINY CSS3!!!!” :D

item.title: By: phil jay
item.dc:creator: phil jay
item.description: Somehow I like the IE8 version of the page more... Maybe because it has a cleaner look :P
item.content:encoded: Somehow I like the IE8 version of the page more… Maybe because it has a cleaner look :P
